page.title: 13Southampton Water.
page.content: This area was a part of the tidal inland waterway known as Southampton Water.There was no land.Ships sail this water to and from the port of Southampton. They are both cargo and passenger ships.A small ferry also crosses from Southampton Town Quay to Hythe on the western banks of Southampton Water and there is a regular{ferry and hydrofoil}service to Isle of Wight. Very few large ships now use the shipway with the exception of {container ships}using the huge container port up river,special{car {transporter ships}from Japan and one or two{passenger liners (Q.E.2,Canberra etc.) What there are more and more of though is dingies,yachts,sailboards in fact all sorts of{leisure craft.
